title: 114_hr4939
content: The Act titled "United States-Caribbean Strategic Engagement Act of 2016" aims to increase engagement with the Caribbean region to enhance diplomatic relations, economic cooperation, support integration efforts, promote economic development, reduce crime and violence, and strengthen the rule of law. The Act aims to enhance diplomatic relations, economic cooperation, support integration efforts, promote economic development, reduce crime and violence, strengthen the rule of law, improve energy security, advance cooperation on democracy and human rights, support public health advances, and expand Internet access in the Caribbean region. The Secretary of State, in coordination with USAID, will submit a multi-year strategy for US engagement within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The Act aims to enhance diplomatic relations, economic cooperation, support integration efforts, promote economic development, reduce crime and violence, strengthen the rule of law, improve energy security, advance cooperation on democracy and human rights, support public health advances, and expand Internet access in the Caribbean region. The Secretary of State, in coordination with USAID, will submit a multi-year strategy for US engagement within 180 days of the Act's enactment. Interested nations in the Caribbean region will work with the US to improve citizen security, reduce drug trafficking, strengthen the rule of law, and enhance energy security through a comprehensive strategy. The Act outlines an approach to improve diplomatic engagement with Caribbean governments, support their efforts to diversify economies, ensure citizen participation in programs, and involve other executive branch agencies. The Secretary of State will provide annual briefings to congressional committees on the implementation of the US engagement strategy with the Caribbean. The Act outlines a strategy for US engagement with the Caribbean region. The President must submit a progress report to congressional committees within 2 years. Definitions for "appropriate congressional committees" and "Caribbean region" are provided. The term "Caribbean region" refers to the Caribbean Basin Security Initiative beneficiary countries. "Security assistance" is defined as per section 502B(d)(2) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
